qas.question: During what Age did Cyprus experience two waves of Greek settlement?
Who did the first wave of Greek settlement consist of?
What year did Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus begin visiting Cyprus?
Cyprus is the birthplace of what two Greek mythological figures?
Cyprus is home to which Greek mythological figures?

context: During the <a0_0>late Bronze Age<a0_0/> the island experienced two waves of Greek settlement. The first wave consisted of <a1_0>Mycenaean Greek traders<a1_0/> who started visiting Cyprus around <a2_0>1400 BC<a2_0/>. A major wave of Greek settlement is believed to have taken place following the Bronze Age collapse of Mycenaean Greece from 1100 to 1050 BC, with the island's predominantly Greek character dating from this period. Cyprus occupies an important role in Greek mythology being the birthplace of <a3_0>Aphrodite and Adonis<a3_0/>, and home to <a4_0>King Cinyras, Teucer and Pygmalion<a4_0/>. Beginning in the 8th century BC Phoenician colonies were founded on the south coast of Cyprus, near present-day Larnaca and Salamis.
